titles.title: Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2023
Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2023
Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2023
To take certain land in the State of Washington into trust for the benefit of the Puyallup Tribe of the Puyallup Reservation, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held
Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 118-423.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 349.

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.activity: Reported By, Markup By, Discharged, Referred To

bill.summary:
Puyallup Tribe of Indians Land Into Trust Confirmation Act of 2023
This bill takes approximately 17.264 acres of specified lands in Pierce County, Washington, into trust for the benefit of the Puyallup Tribe of the Puyallup Reservation. Lands taken into trust shall be part of the tribe's reservation.
The United States shall not be liable for any environmental contamination that occurred on or before the date on which the land is taken into trust.
Further, the bill prohibits gaming on the land taken into trust.
